title: Thank you
body: I really would like to thank all the hard working professionals at Winchester A&E. I was treated so well from the moment I arrived to the moment I left by extremely competent and kind staff. Thank you for looking after me to the best of your abilities.

title: Great practice, staff and care
body: When I attended Kingston for both of my vaccine appointments I received an excellent service. The drs and nurses were fantastic - extremely caring and made you feel at ease yet efficient and well organised.

title: Exceptional experience
body: I was seen by the most friendly doctor. What a kind person that really cares. The aftercare was also exceptional. The best experience since being a child. Thank you

title: Excellent service from both GP and Nursing Team
body: I attended for my post natal visit and my baby’s vaccinations. The team from receptionists/nurses and GP were kind, caring and professional. I didn’t feel pressured for time despite the constraints of the huge demand on primary care at the moment and was given chance to breast feed my baby through his vaccinations to make it less stressful for him too.

title: Amazing menopause clinic
body:
I had two telephone appointments during the last 4 months with the menopause clinic.
I am so grateful to the consultant as she listened to me and advised me so patiently and transparently. I was able to discuss all my concerns and clear my doubts before starting the HRT. The waiting list to get the appointment is horrendous. I really hope this excellent life-changing support could reach out promptly to more women in need. 
I have nothing else but only praise for the menopause clinic dedicated service.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Pleasant Vaccination
body: Having one of the first slots of the afternoon session meant the car park was almost empty when I arrived and that there wasn't any particular waiting. The staff were friendly and in a good mood. My details were easily found, the jab was done without problem or pain. I relaxed a bit in the hall which was about 1/4 full, it was good that there were staff there also, there was plenty of people entering the hall, then I left. There was a queue to park by the time I left.

title: Fantastic practice
body: I was recommended this practice by my grandmother who had been with them for decades and their standards haven’t slipped . They are fantastic, from polite, patient reception to knowledgeable caring doctors and nurses who go above and beyond would just like to thank them for their exceptional standard of care. They provide a very exceptional standard of care cannot praise them enough.

title: caring obliging professionals
body: I went in for a partial knee replacement in April when i met the surgeon it became immediately apparent I was in excellent hands, from the moment I arrived until I left, the care I received from all the staff on the 3rd floor where I recovered from my operation were amazing, All staff, nurses, surgeon and consultants and super gold star for the physiotherapist they were terrific, very attentive and friendly. The hospital is clean and the service was very good. I would recommend this hospital to anyone every time, if I ever have any other problems I will go only there unless I have no choice, the BMI Independent will be my first choice 100%

title: Chemotherapy suit absolutely amazing
body: Took my house friend for first visit to the Chemothreapy suit.on arrival I booked him in reception staff so welcoming friendly kind and shown sensitive approach.I left to return once patient was ready to come home.they was extremely short staffed due to illness and maternity leave.my friend told me how they was running around reassuring patient they would get there treatment but running late.drinks offered with snacks constantly throughout the day.nurses was so lovely kind and compassionate.I’d called the admin department earlier on that same day with a concern I felt completely listened to again with kindness and was giving advise.when I went to pick my friend up he had medication which a nurse had wrote very clearly on the boxes how and when they should be taken.both myself and my friend was able to relax knowing exactly what meds was how and when to take them .all had been explained what injections was and how to store them and day district nurse would be calling .the chemotherapy suit staff are a credit to the trust the cleanliness of the unit was 100% .I’d rate this suit well above and beyond those lovely nurses certainly do the job through guanine patient care and goes well above and beyond in shown compassion. id like to say a heart full thank you to all whom work in the chemotherapy unit

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Highly recommended practice
body:
I have been with the practice for six years. This last year I have not had the usual access to hospital care due to the pandemic. The practice have been brilliant at managing all the things secondary care normally do at what I know is a time of extreme pressure.
I want to thanks all the staff who have really helped me over the last year for not only their consistently good clinical care but also their compassionate, dedicated manner.

title: Very very lucky to have them
body:
I have nothing but the highest praise for this surgery and staff.
In fact id like to thank them for they have always gone out of their way to be not just helpfull but compassionate and caring.
Words i never hear about friends doctors surgery.
Your treated as an individual that they are caring for.
Not like surveyor belt doctors of today in some practices.
They deserve high praise

title: Always get an appointment
body: Although I rarely see a gp at this practice, I have always been able to get a same day appointment with a nurse practitioner. The nurses are professional and knowledgeable and can issue prescriptions etc so that is fine by me!

title: Super department
body: Arrived at 9am .treated fantastic. The doctor and his team were fantastic. As ive just move to Gloucestershire this hospital is the best

title: Visit to A&E
body:
I attended A&E following feinting in May 21.  I have a multitude of conditions so it may have been related to heart or lung issues or something else.

The staff were excellent throughout.  Tests were completed and I was not rushed during a consultation trying to isolate what had happened.  The diagnosis was spot on and the Doctor even spoke to my wife by 'phone to verify what had happened when I feinted.

Thank you to everyone involved for their professionalism and care.

title: Excellent practice
body:
The system in place for vacations is excellent. It’s swift & slick. I felt safe at all times. All staff are really efficient. The nurses issuing the vaccination are friendly, professional and very reassuring. This exceeded all expectations & they are all doing an excellent job. 
Thank you all very much for the work you are doing in keeping us all safe.

title: Well done and thank you!
body: During this very tough time for general practice, facing such demand during a global pandemic, I would like to thank the practice. The reception staff are always so pleasant, accommodating and kind and never make me feel like I am causing inconvenience. The nursing care I received recently was exemplary and the waiting times to be seen have been remarkably short. The practice is run extremely efficiently and communication via text message throughout the pandemic has been much appreciated. The practice really has put a lot of thought into providing an efficient service that remains very patient centred, and have provided face to face assessment for me and my family when it has been needed. I’m most grateful for the hard work of all the staff, particularly in light of the past year and the tendency for the media/politicians to cast GPs in such a negative light at times. Thank you again for your excellence, kindness and hard work.

title: Friendly and efficient
body: I have always had a positive experience at Cleadon Park. Staff are always extremely friendly and today I had my first Covid vaccine and they have gone over and above being efficient so people didn’t have to hang around for longer than required, but making you feel well looked after by the friendly staff and nurses.

title: Acted with speed
body: We have been so impressed with the care we have received from this surgery. My partner had a suspicious looking mole; within 3 hours of calling, my partner had been seen and within 2 days of her appointment we, we had received a letter of referral to a dermatologist at West Suffolk Hospital. Thanks to the speed of our GP, my partner was very quickly diagnosed with melanoma (stage 1a) and it was caught and dealt with quickly. Having moved recently from an area where we were not overly impressed with our former surgery, we feel so reassured to be registered with Hardwicke House! Thank you for all you do and continue to do!

title: Great service
body: Contacted the surgery very late on Friday evening as my symptoms had exacerbated acutely. The receptionist was excellent, very calm, kind and professional. She got me an appointment that same evening at Riverside Clinic who were also excellent. I cannot praise the individuals or the overall service higher, thank you.

title: Really Good Practice
body: Lovely team of health care staff, friendly and understanding. Best nurses, know how to put patients at ease, including grown up needle phobics like me.

title: Wonderful people and service
body:
I attended the minor injuries on 13 and 14 May following a fall and a resulting head injury. I was so pleased with the way that the unit along with radiographic department dealt with me. My thanks in particular to the sister in charge, but overall you have a good team there.

Great to also see that the staff are not penalised with car parking charges as well.

title: Excellent service
body: Attended for a COVID 19 vaccination. The procedure was so well executed from the car park to the chap at the exit. Well done to all involved, first class. Thank you.

title: Outstanding
body: I would like to congratulate the surgery on the way it has administered and delivered the COVID19 vaccination programme. It has been incredibly reassuring during this stressful and difficult time to be under the care of such a well managed and efficient practice. The whole process felt safe and well managed. I would also like to thank the volunteers who politely ensured that people knew what to do and where to go. Thank you to the doctors and nurses who administered the injections with professional care and sensitivity.

title: Good practice
body: The staff have always been very helpful during a very worrying year due to many health issues.  Always got telephone consultations quickly because of health issues, and a visit from a Doctor recently due to health issues because unable to visit surgery.

title: Efficient second jab.
body:
Queue moved quickly, staff cheerful.
I wouldn't need to say more if there wasn't a 100 character minimum review length.
Thanks

title: covid vaccine
body: very please with how quickly i was seen and vacinated  the staff were very helpful every thing was very effeciant

title: Helped me so much
body: I needed help as didn't have a dentist and had impacted wisdom tooth infection with lockjaw the macfact think was called were so helpful they do a fantastic job in difficult times

title: Nightmare
body:
This practice is all over the shop. It has too many patients and not enough staff... yes we are in a pandemic but the online procedure for making an appointment to speak with a doctor for a medical appointment is farcical . The on line form has redirected me to call the practice. The practice automated message says use the on line form. I’m not that old but the on line procedure is not easy and must be very difficult for some people to use. I have no idea where all the five star reviews come from. I tried to ring the practice at 3 pm yesterday and phone was answered gone 4 o’clock.I was redirected to Katie Rd. I rang Katie Rd straight after who told me they were full and not taking any more appointments and ring my GP the next day. I’m on the phone again @ 9 am 28 in the queue. 31 minutes later I’m now number five in the queue... This is not five stars 
I wouldn’t mind but this was like this pre covid but now possibly worse

title: Can't fault this gp surgery!
body: I have been registered with this GP practice for over 20 years now and within the last year I have had nothing but continued support and care and great empathy not only from my GP but also other members of staff at this practice. I cannot fault them as a practice. I am so thankful for the hard work the GP puts in daily enabling him to provide great patient care. Thank you so much for all your help and continued support during what has been a very challenging year. All your hard work as a surgery is hugely appreciated by myself and my family, thank you!

title: Poor service
body:
I stay more then 4 hours with my 3 years old son and nobody come to us .
I don’t recommend this hospital .
Is a shame .

readBy.name: Kingston Hospital NHS Foundation Trust Diabetes Team

title: doctors give conflicting advice
body: seen 3 doctors for same issue and all 3 gave conflicting advice on what medication i should take, its like none take time to read your medical history & just appease you with medications

title: Burbage Surgery
body: Administration is appalling , reception staff great but no support for them.  No online facilities, Covid vaccine is totally unacceptable, whole Doctor availability is appauling and understaffed.  Considering portal for NHS whole process below sub standard.  Would not recommend

title: Very pleasant staff
body: I recently had my COVID vaccination at this GP and everyone throughout the process was very polite and helpful.

title: Great practice
body: King Edward ward, you are all amazing. From the tea lady, receptionists and nurses, you all provide excellent care and make my visits calm and relaxing.  What a great team.

title: Impossible to see a doctor .
body: Seriously deteriorated since Lakeside took over. They need to be sacked or prosecuted for negligence.Pharmacy staff very aggressive and disorganized. Reception staff  very sweet but helpless. Doctors non-existant. The system where you have to ring every morning at 8 until they can book a call back is ridiculous. 45mins+to get through on the phoneThere are going to be a lot of serious cases undiagnosed.Please buck up

title: COVID vaccine
body:
Had my second jab today.
What an efficient practice.
Very well organised, very quick to go through to get the jab.
Exactly on time too.
Thank you so much for your hard work 😊

title: Great Department
body: The whole experience from start to finish was exceptional, friendly knowledgeable staff and a brilliant surgeon with a comforting reassuring manner.

title: Excellent Surgery In All Ways
body: I have recently moved to the area and am so pleased I have registered with this practise. Very professional, efficient and polite receptionists. Very pleasant dedicated nurses. All coronavirus vaccine  queries and arrangements handled brilliantly. The whole venue is spotless and pleasant. I have not accessed the doctors services but feel assured this will be on a par with everyone else. A credit to the NHS.

title: Worst GP practice for trying to get an…
body: Trying to get an appointment is so so hard that most times you give up trying. Not offering any appointments for a future date at all. The only option is to call at 8am every morning hoping for them to answer the phone. Have tried all this week with no luck. How is that even acceptable? Total lack of care on the part of the practice management. Looking to move practice now. Have never before felt the need to leave a negative review for any NHS service, but this is beyond comprehension and totally unacceptable.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Buckshaw village surgery have been really efficient over these covid times. The staff are really friendly, helpful, diligent and hardworking. They have been super organised at getting us all vaccinated ahead of most other parts of the country and offer excellent service. Thank you so much to all the lovely doctors and nurses at the practice. Keep up with the good work. Cannot express my appreciation enough for maintaining such high levels of service at these pressuring times. Well done! :-)

title: Amazingly wonderful GP surgery and staff
body: Gold plated GP surgery and staff. I'm so proud to have this practice as my GP. They have improved so much and really deserved the best comments. Not only have they been great to my family, they have been so organized and efficient with the covid vaccination that I believe they are a good role model for other GP practices. Seriously exceptional outstanding service. Thank you all to everyone that works there. You are truly amazing!

title: Rubbish service
body: I tried to call the practice for an appointment but took me 8 days to get through to them about my prostate condition changing and was told that the doctor would phone me back that was 2 and a half weeks ago and still waiting they either didn't pass on to the doctor or couldn't be bothered absolutely waste of time bothering to call them will be looking for another doctor to help me as my dad had prostate cancer and had his removed so it is always in the back of my mind that something is wrong

title: Great GP
body: I can’t thank the GP at Broom Lane enough. He has been treating a complicated rash on my daughters face, showing us great kindness and respect. At a time when all staff in general practice are so overworked he showed none of this stress to us and went out of his way to listen to our concerns and support us.

title: Great Vaccine location
body: I have had my vaccine here today. Very polite and helpful staff. They were very organised and happy to answer questions. I would like to recommend this location.

title: Excellent Service
body:
Called by practice to book a review appointment. 
Arrived early on the day and seen early. 
Great clinical care from staff and great service as always from support staff.

title: Uncaring & Unhelpful
body: This surgery has always been really good but my latest experience has left me feeling uncared for and let down. Rude staff. Failure to do what they promise & ultimately place patients at risk. Would not recommend

title: Fantastic care
body: I was rushed in with a heart attack and from the very start I was treated with dignity and kindness. When I finally reach the ward Kilverston I was treated with kindness. Dignity. And as an individual. Your HCAS go above and beyond there role. They are the most caring HCAS had to deal with. They find time, even when busy, to talk to you. Nothing is too much trouble for them. Again I can’t thank and praise them enough

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Service
body: This is my usual surgery and I have been recently for both of my coronavirus jabs. Smooth service, friendly and welcoming staff. Would recommend.

title: Very Pleased with the service
body:
Trying times with difficult circumstances, however attend the morning clinic today for my second covid vaccination 
The Reception staff were welcoming and efficient + medical staff who gave me my jab were good

title: Great experience
body: What's there not to like about Blakelands Hospital. From being escorted from the car through pre-med then into theatre and post procedure care and attention was brilliant. Standard of service and cleanliness was second to none. Very impressed with the Covid-19 procedure which demonstrates a commitment to protect patients and staff.

title: Outstanding Practice
body:
The Best GP practice, the Doctors, are experienced polite and very helpful. The Service received  from the Doctors are outstanding, they answer any questions and never makes me feels been rushed. Administrative staff and Nurse are very supportive there communication skills are excellent. Generally it is an outstanding surgery practice to register .
I am glad to have the best GP practice.

title: Fantastic Surgery
body: Throughout the Pandemic the Staff have been very supportive and my care from the Doctors has been flawless.  Thank you NHS.

title: GREAT SERVICE AND SUPREMELY PROFESSIONAL
body:
From my pre op assessment to my cataract surgery Spa Medica were superb.Their friendly approach and expert service was first class.
I approached my surgery with a bit of trepidation but needn’t have worried.On arrival everything was explained and the care and attention from the theatre team was brilliant. We even joked about putting in a request for different music when the surgery on my other eye is due.
I would recommend Spa Medica to anyone needing eye treatment for their attention and professional service.
Thank you Spa Medica

title: Excellent service
body: I would like to commend Abbey Medical Centre and all the staff working there for their excellent service.  My daughter has been having some mental health issues and after a very prompt telephone review she was seen and referred the next day.  Throughout the pandemic I have also had a few medical issues and I have had nothing but fantastic service via telephone and e-consult.  Thank you.

title: Excellent Hospital.
body: I was admitted to day care unit all staff were kind, understanding and very caring. My consultant was excellent answering my questions and concerns.

title: Friendly, fast and focussed
body: I attended Buckshaw Surgery for my second Covid-19 vaccination today, arriving ten minutes early. On arrival the Marshalls outside were friendly and smiling despite getting soaked in the rain. On walking in the nurse took my details straight away and then carried on wiping down seats, the waiting room was spotless. I was through within a couple of minutes to have my vaccination which was over before I knew it. I left with advice, a leaflet and my updated card within 8 minutes and before my appointment time! The whole process was a well oiled and professional procedure with everyone involved happy, smiling and very friendly. I would highly recommend Buckshaw surgery for their professionalism and friendliness. Thank you for my vaccination.

title: New booking systems
body: The online booking system on the practice  web site works really well. I was sceptical at first  but the lovely  receptionist guided me through how to access. Ive used it a number  of times  since over the last few weeks and can say  my queries so far are all resolved the same day and call back from my doctor within a few hours...So much better than having to  ring in and struggling to get through on the phone.

title: 2ND COVID JAB
body: Firstly the Lane End Medical Practice seems to be a good one. Clean and well designed and in a good location for transport.   My first Covid Jab was on a Saturday in January 2021 and I arrived early and joined a short queue and was then asked when my app was and told to go in. All was quick and efficient.  My 2nd Jab was on a Thursday-therefore I needed to take time off work - I arrived early and joined a very long queue that stretched up the road and around into another road.  Eventually I was seen over 20 mins after the scheduled appointment.   Really happy to have received my vaccination and the NHS staff were very good but not as well organized this time.   So not a criticism at all. Just a comment.

title: Definitely recommend to anyone
body:
Great staff who made me so at ease, always helpful, I had a hip replacement which went well.
Food brilliant, good choice.

title: Superb patient care
body: I went today for an Endoscopy (Never the most enjoyable of experiences). From the minute I entered the department to the minute I left the experience was faultless. Staff were welcoming, reassuring and friendly. The procedure was carried out with empathy and consideration. An exemplary service, of which Cannock Hospital should be proud.

title: Caring and helpful staff
body: My 90 year old Dad was admitted following a fall on the evening of Monday 10/05/21. He is registered partially sighted, registered deaf and has significant mobility problems. The staff were so kind and caring. I was allowed to stay with him as his carer and this made a tremendous difference to him in those first few hours. I can't remember the name of the staff but there was a registered nurse and a support worker and we were in Merlin 1-4. The young man who assessed my Dad was particularly kind and patient. I'm sure I recall him saying he wasn't a doctor but I unfortunately I can't recall his name. He arranged for my Dad to have CT scan and admission with emphasis on physio and OT assessment. Just what he needed. Please pass on my Dad's and the family's gratitude for the care and help provided.

title: HARD WORKING , HELPFUL AND EXCELLENT STAFF
body: What a great team of individuals operating the vaccination centre. So professional, helpful, courteous  and a true credit to our beleaguered and grossly underfunded and under resourced NHS. Don’t stand on your doorstep clapping - do something more constructive and support any initiative that means these fantastic health system workers are properly paid. Simples!

title: Unhelpful at times
body:
Whilst I have found the medical/nursing staff to be nothing other than professional and helpful, I feel that the surgery could benefit from a consideration of my recent experience there.

On the Tuesday before Easter,  I undertook a urinalysis test at home (I am a healthcare professional) which indicated a urine infection. I emailed the surgery, reported my result & asked for antibiotics. The surgery replied on Wednesday asking me some questions, which I answered. On Maundy Thursday in the middle of the day (I was at work) the surgery emailed me asking me to bring in a urine sample by 1300 hours “for the nurse to check”. Of course I was unable to do so. The surgery was then closed until the Tuesday after Easter. Just before 1500 hours on the Tuesday after Easter I took a urine sample to the surgery and was told that I was too late. I explained that I had had an infection for a week, had not been able to get there earlier in the day and suggested that surely there was someone on the premises who could test the urine and prescribe appropriately. The staff member said she would see what she could do and would ring me later. The very polite staff member did ring me & advised that I would need to bring in another sample before 1300 hours the next day & that the surgery would be open at 0800 hours. I explained that I would be at work and could not attend then. The staff member was adamant that no-one was available at the surgery to help me despite my having had an infection for a week. I enquired as to which day the surgery opened early, so I could get there before work, & was told that the next day of early opening would be the following Monday. I explained that this would mean that I would be waiting 2 weeks for antibiotics in the presence of clear infection & that this is not good practice, with potential for sepsis, but to no avail. On the following Monday, 2 weeks after my initial contact with the surgery regarding this matter, I took in a urine sample. Whilst at the surgery I asked if I could arrange to speak to a Doctor about my elderly mother. I was told “this cannot be done at the window”. I explained that I was not requesting to speak to the Doctor at the window but wanted to make an appointment for a doctor to ring. The staff member was adamant that I must ring in to make an appointment & that she would not be able to help. I duly rang & spent precisely 1 hour waiting for the surgery to answer the telephone. Once the telephone was answered an appointment was arranged swiftly and politely.

I eventually got antibiotics over 2 weeks after my initial contact with surgery & an appointment was arranged for my mother. However, I feel that the overall experience represents incredibly poor patient service. Why turn someone away from a face to face conversation to make them wait on a phone for 1 hour? Why not recognise the importance of dealing with infection swiftly? I urge Monton Medical to consider better training/support of its staff.

title: Incredible Organisation
body: My wife and I have just had our second Covid-19 vaccination and I just wanted to say a huge thanks you to both the practice and the staff at Lowford Vaccination centre. From the incredible smooth appointment system to the organisation at the vaccination centre. It seems people are quick to criticise but a little more reticent to pay tributes I just wanted to put that right. Once again many manyu thanks for a fantastic service

title: Complaint process leads to stress.
body:
After Terrible experience after operation and being discharged even though I was in terrible pain... then going through the proper channels to make a complaint I was given a process date for Hospital to  Reply of 3 months  having not had a reply I contacted hospital and was told letter was on its way......Letter was telling me  they need more time ! An extra 5 weeks ....and given written confirmation of new date...or they would inform me...
This date has now expired and  still no corespondent from the hospital .
So today wrote a complaint about a complaint....
Just shows how they view complaints...
They Don’t.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Efficient, effective and kind
body: Thank you to all the staff who treated me on May 14. They were without exception reassuring, quick and efficient, enabling a good outcome. 111 and the ambulance service also helped equally effectively. I live alone, getting older, and sudden emergencies can be overwhelming.

title: COVID vaccine centre 1
body: Extremely rude customer service. I was there to ask a quick question and individual was very rude and completely ignored me at the vaccine centre 1. I have the photo of the person however that’s against the policy for that reason I am unable to give identity.

title: COVID vaccination excellent organisation
body: Visited the surgery this morning for my second vaccination. The whole process is so well carried out. From the car parking attendant to the nurses carrying out the injection. Excellent service.

title: Receptionists dreadful!!
body: I must agree with the majority of poor reviews for this practice. It takes ages to get through by phone and a number of the receptionists are argumentative and downright obnoxious. I actually avoid getting in touch unless absolutely necessary. After many years at this practice we’ve seen it deteriorate dramatically to the point that my family will be moving to a better practice.

title: EXCELLENT PRACTICE
body: Had an endoscopy yesterday. Although the procedure wasn't the best thing that's ever happened to me, 😂 the staff were absolutely fantastic with me. They explained everthing and put me at ease so much so i had the procedure without sedation. I actually would like to apologise for all the coughing and wretching they had to put up with. Very caring and professional from the moment i arrived. Thank you!

title: The saga continues...
body: Having previously been told that getting to see a GP at this practice is down to luck and therefore there is nothing I can do to see my NHS GP, I decided to book to see a private GP (Highly recommend using the Babylon Health app - extremely good service). The private GP has referred me to a specialist, but Bupa need my NHS GP to complete a short form to authorise this. I rang on Tuesday morning, the receptionist found my email with the required form and asked me to ring back after 15:00 to check on status. I rang back at 15:30 and spoke to the same woman. She had no idea who I was or anything about the form so we had to start again. She said that my form had been sent to the GPs. I asked what time that day they would fill this in (bearing in mind this form requires a few sentences from them only) and she told me they may be able to fill it in by Friday and for me to ring back on Friday. I asked why they couldn't fill it in today and she said she couldn't help me on that point... I rang back on Friday and spoke to the same woman. She had no idea who I was or anything about the form. I had to go through the whole explanation again. She put me on hold for a few minutes and then came back on to say she would ring me back later that day. As expected, she never rang me back. This surgery is one of the worst I have ever experienced. Not only are they continuing to deny me access to a NHS GP, but they now deny me access to a private healthcare too - shame on you! I note that this surgery has replied to all the other negative reviews on this site, but they have not replied to mine - why is that? You have all my details.

title: Really unpleasant experience
body:
My son needed Gp attention request app Thursday the call on Tuesday, by a locom GP, upset I'm waisting her time (I had private Gp attending my son problem in the maine time).
She wasn't interested how my son responding to the treatment prescribed by private Gp, what is the evolution.......... 
Just I'm waisting her time.....

title: Excellent Service
body: Received both Covid-19 Jabs at Whitley House - Friendly and efficient service on both occasions. Many Thanks to all concerned.

title: Practice Improvement
body:
I believe that the steep rise in patient numbers particularly in the elderly bracket combined with a shortage of surgery staff has resulted in a number of administrative delays. A particular problem has been the waiting time for the high number of patients requesting appointments by phone. However, I would like to record my thanks to the senior and support staff who have recently managed a substantial reduction in waiting time. Some of us oldies often say ‘things are not what they used to be’, but in fact so many are very much better. 
My thanks to all the medical and support staff for all your efforts during this very demanding period.

title: Kind receptionist
body: It was a real pleasure to speak to a receptionist who actually cared, despite being put in an awkward situation this person was so kind and phoned back on several occasions as they had said they would. In a caring environment people have forgotten how to care and I feel this person has gone above and beyond the role to make a patient feel valued.

title: Extremely upset
body: came here for a checkup as advised by NHS 11 web service, which asked me to seek attension immediately (today) . So i went there gave my details and waited. And the lady ()at the triage called me. I told her my issues about a real bad pain and swelling at my feet. I could not even sleep whole night yesterday. She said you will have to wait 4 to 5 hours. I said that is fine . I waited there . After like 10 minutes she called my name and told me "no one here will see you , you need t¥ go to GP" . This is absolutely appalling treatment. No one even bothered to have a look even after me waiting . I want to know who made this decision to send me back . This is why people end up going to A & E. I followed all procedures. My feet is hurting like hell and i feel upset and sad.

title: Repeat Prescription
body: It takes half an hour to even get the phone to ring and enter a queue as the line is constantly engaged. The receptionist will just fob you off with any excuse under the sun. I’m not sure if it is the same woman every time but they are extremely rude and do not want to help. The worst surgery I have ever dealt with, I was told to drop a repeat prescription into a box located at the back of the surgery but was not told this box is not accessible at weekends. Every surgery I have had in the past you can call the reception and the repeat could be pushed by the doctor. I work mon-fri 8-6 so people like me have absolutely no way of putting in a repeat prescription. I now have had my condition flare up again as I cannot get my second monthly anti biotic prescribed on my last visit. If there is another way then I was not notified by this rude receptionist she couldn’t wait to get me off the phone. My partner also called in with a bad back and eventually got her to make an appointment after she tried to tell him he had ‘back spasms’. It’s not a one off, there is clearly an unhelpful cycle at this surgery. I have also recently found out I was pregnant.... (unhelpful again when I asked for info from the receptionist) and the only reason I do not swap surgeries is because the assigned midwife is so lovely. However if this is what it is to be for the foreseeable future I will have no choice but to change. Coming from the Old Exchange surgery the Grove Medical has a lot to answer for. I would like to say the doctors and nurses are all so great and really do care for their patients when you finally get to see them just a shame the call time and reception who let the place down.

title: No after care
body: 94year old mother was admitted on 13th February 2021, she had a hip operation.She was discharged after2weeks, 3 months on she still has metal staples all the way down her thigh.These should have been removed before she left hospital.There has been no after care for my mother from this operation.Why haven’t these staples been removed.

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Impossible to contact this Practice !
body: I have recently tried to ring the St John’s Medical Centre and after hanging on the line for over 30 minutes my call was disconnected. It was also impossible to send a Ask My GP email as this “service” has been suspended. Would the Practice Manager like to recommend an alternative method or point of contact?

title: Bad practice
body: Upon husband getting admitted, no visits,no calls explaining treatment or updates,,trying call hospital for information,no one answers the phone,2 full days trying to call acute assessment unit and nobody will answer the phone

title: Lovely staff
body: Lovely pleasant helpful staff, lovely surgery highly recommend, nothing seemed to much trouble all Covid -19 measures in place

title: Dreadful
body:
Still waiting for my second jab. Now a week overdue and getting no feedback or help. Go around in circles trying to get advice.
Why can't something be done?

title: Fantastic practice that goes up and beyond
body: I have been a patient at this practice for many years . The whole team at Barlow are very professional, caring and understanding always .. even in this pandemic they have been there for myself and always been contactable and responded to any emails and concerns. I always speak very highly of Barlow medical centre and would recommend to everyone.

title: Impossible to Contact
body: The surgery does not answer telephone calls. Waiting on hold twice for 5+ minutes without any response. Diverted then to the econsult system which is a totally retrograde step. Contacting healthcare is now more difficult, not simple and efficient as it should be but then this is probably why it has been implemented.

title: Does this service even exist???
body:
I have been referred to NSFT twice in the last 18 months. My first referral was classed as 'urgent' in January 2020 when I was dealing with bipolar hypomania and the second was at the beginning of April this year. I have never heard from them on either occasion. 

I have been referred in the past and received adequate treatment, but through admittedly no fault of their own, the waiting lists for appropriate treatments were 18 months long. 

Thankfully, I can just about afford, with help from my parents, to afford semi-regular private CBT therapy but it is nowhere near enough to help me manage my ongoing symptoms. I can't imagine what it must be like for those that don't have this ability or this support system. 

Mental health services nationwide and poorly resourced, but NSFT is both poorly resourced and abysmally managed. People with severe mental health problems are left to their own devices, as though these are problems that can be easily fixed with a positive mental attitude. I am always frustrated at the management of our local services, and often find the situation entirely upsetting. The service isn't just inadequate, for many people whose lives depend on accessing mental health care, it is basically non-existant.

title: Brilliant Staff and Doctors
body: I have been registered with this practice for over 10 years and have to say, nothing is too much trouble.  The staff are professional and welcoming and the GP's are very attentive they always follow you up if your unwell.  Compared to my previous GP these are a class above.

title: Rude staff
body: The staff were extremely rude while talking on the phone and are incredibly inconsiderate when providing information about appointments. They often give appointment slots within 2 or 3 months of availability which  is appalling. Also, the staff always sound uninterested and frustrated when dealing with patients which puts off people off from going there.

title: Great care
body:
Brought in by ambulance to CCU via A&E
Staff could not be more caring and helpful Nothing is ever a problem

title: Was a good practice
body: I use to have no problems with the gables at all. But since my last appointment (over phone). They have lost my notes so I can’t get the medication my doctor told me I could get. I’ve not gone to work because I need this medication. I talk to reception and secretaries, and when they say they will call me back they never do. For people who look after people with mental health. They do not do a good job at all.

title: Excellent care and consideration
body:
I recently attended Tunbridge Wells Hospital for Surgery. All the members of staff who treated me were without exception very caring and considerate and treated me with respect.
I cannot fault the way members of staff whatever their role looked after me. They all behaved in a very professional manner at all times and made me feel that my recovery was important to them.
I am most grateful to them all.

title: Fantastic Service
body:
I recently attended out of hours at the Countess of Chester due to a painful foot.

I couldn't have been more impressed with the speedy diagnosis, professionalism of the staff and dedication to my care.

Thank you so much!

author: Amos77
title: Getting more support for my ADHD disorder.
body:
I contacted Lower Clapton Group Practice through the askmyGP app yesterday about therapy during this very stressful time for my ADHD.
I was called the next day and given a thorough briefing about the steps that I would have to take to get further CBT. As well as being listened to and given good advice by Dr Smith who was very patient and understanding.

title: Run by ghosts
body:
No one answers the phone, impossible to get an appointment, the e-consult either tells you to call 111, you never see the same doctor twice, before covid you were always waiting at least 40mins in the waiting room. 
Honestly? Avoid if you can

title: Disappointed
body: You can no longer see the doctor of your choice at this practice.  You have to enter your concerns online and a random doctor will call you back.  I have been call back on more than one occassion by a doctor I don't like because he doesn't listen!

title: fed up standing outside in rain
body: why do we have to stand outside in rain when waiting room is empty you have a nuth room for 30  people to stand inside

title: No Chance of an Appointment
body:
Since the coronavirus outbreak, I absolutely understand there can’t be many face to face appointments. But I can’t even get a telephone one.

I try every morning to be told to call in the afternoon. I call in the afternoon to be told all spaces gone and there is no way I can book an appointment over the phone for a couple of days in advance. You MUST call on the day.

That’s not working. 

In addition, my smear test is due and has been for several months. They don’t have any appointments for that either and mine is really essential because the last one came back with an issue. 

I’m in pain, and I feel sick all the time. It’s not A&E worthy but if it carries on where I can’t be seen by my GP, I’m sure it will be.

title: The need for maps and directions
body:
I had an appointment at the Breast Screening unit recently. The invitation had no map to show where it was (not your issue) and there is nothing on your web-site that helps. I saw no signage from the main road and the volunteer receptionist tried to show me on a large map on the wall but really a paper map would have been so much more help! Since the BS Unit is always near the Urology Building when it is on your site then perhaps the position of the Urology Unit could be made clear and that, in itself, would be of benefit.
I know your hospital is not responsible for sending out the Screening Invitations but some help to get to the right place at the right time would be a great help!
As it was I walk on a stick, I was 12 minutes late for my appointment arriving upset, hot and in pain due to my arthritis and which took me 2 days to recover from. Not your fault, I know, but there are lessons that can be learned from this very stressful situation! 
Please can steps be taken to help others to find where they need to go quickly and easily! 
Thank you.

title: Gone to the dogs
body: I have been at this surgery for 30 years and since my doctor left over a year ago the service on every level including extremely rude front line staff has gone from excellent to poor!!How this as occured in such a short period of time is shocking and saddening.

title: Concern about contacting the surgery
body:
I luckily rarely have to use the Pines GP surgery and  am a healthcare professional. I called to ask about how to access a treatment and was asked to call back after 0800am . I did explain that this was difficult as I start work at 0800am apparently am not eligible for on line booking. 
So I tried -the line is constantly engaged and after 4 days of trying went to see a private GP had a very thorough consultation and was prescribed the drug I requested . 
I finally managed to get through 13.5.21 after 9 attempts and then a 15 minute wait once through. 
Today I have dropped my printed private prescription and notes in uniform having to explain what it was through a crack in the door in front of 4 other patients waiting to be let in. One was an elderly lady in a wheelchair left to wait . 
I have been home vaccinating for other practices in Northampton who have someone greeting patients at the door . My husband has already moved to another practice as he has had a serious illness and needs the assurance he can get an appointment booked. 
Please can you assess your telephone accessibility for patients . 
At least if there was a call line where the number you were in the queue would help?? Continual line engaged is not good customer service.

title: Fantastic Practice with caring and helpful staff
body:
I attended for a routine smear test on 14th May at 9.30am.
The nurse I saw, who unfortunately I can’t remember her name, deserves recognition.
She was so thorough in explaining exactly what she was going to do and why.
She was friendly, caring and put me totally at ease.
Considering the pressure anyone who works for the NHS must be feeling at the moment, she did not come across as rushed or stressed.
She is a credit to the NHS and I was really impressed by her level of professionalism and care.
